data.title: Mutli select in scm viewlet
data.body:
1. I am not able to select multiple items in the scm viewlet
2. I think we can survive without this, even though it is a regression

data.title: Keep commit box input while committing
data.body:
1. Have a dirty file
2. Commit it -> while commit is in progress the file is still shown in the git viewlet
3. This is different than our stable behavior when the file would immediatly dissepear with the progress

The current behavior is acceptable but the problem is that I as many users are used to the previosu behavior and might think something is wrong (did commit take my file into account?)

data.title: Git undo confirmation is killing me
data.body:
1. I want to somehow tell it to never ask again (give me third options, yes - never ask again)
2. The problem is if you are using the mouse you click on the undo and then you have to go to the center of the screen and click yes

It is nicer in dark theme

data.title: Add ability to run multiple background/watching tasks
data.body:
Currently, it is possible to run only one watching task.
But often it is required to run multiple background tasks to start the project (e.g. "`npm run-script start-server`" and "`npm run-script start-client`").

data.title: Search: selection lags behind focus
data.body:
When I quickly move the arrow keys up/down through search results I see the selection is lagging behind the focus. I know we have some timeout logic to prevent too many opens from happening but I think every second or so you still decide to let that timeout win. Imho the debouncing is not working correctly:

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/22148833/bf977b3c-df10-11e6-8bf7-a4ff78d7f571.gif)

data.title: Git - viewlet doesn't update after a git init
data.body:
In a fresh workspace: 
- git init
- git add .

The changes do not do not show up in the SCM viewlet and I have to reload the window.

data.title: [1.9.0-insider] text/x-code-output no longer works to identify identify output
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

I use `text/x-code-output` (https://github.com/formulahendry/vscode-code-runner/blob/master/package.json#L196) to identify output window for output highlight.

Previously, it works like below:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1050213/22146705/8465a9c8-df40-11e6-9f8f-2717bb481e46.png)

For 1.9.0-insider, it no longer works:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1050213/22146672/6ddac152-df40-11e6-9fa6-d0873b02b383.png)


Is this change by design? If yes, is there other ways to do highlight for output window?

data.title: Cannot run tasks
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 7, 64bit

I have tasks.json that I use on several machines. But I cannot run tasks from it on one of machines.
vscode sees tasks from tasks.json but it doesn't perform them ("Ctrl+P", "task taskname"). When I press "Ctrl+Shift+B" I get an error:
spawn UNKNOWN

I tried to fully reinstall vscode (with deletion of %USER%/.vscode and and AppData/Roaming/Code). It doesn't help.

tasks.json:
{
    // See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=733558
    // for the documentation about the tasks.json format
    "options": {
        "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}/afolder"
    },
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "cmd",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "args": ["/C"],
    "showOutput": "always",
    "suppressTaskName": true,
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "cleanall",
            "args": ["python waf cleanall"]
        },
        {
            "taskName": "configure",
            "args": ["python waf configure"]
        },
        {
            "taskName": "buildall",
            "isWatching": false,
            "problemMatcher": {
                "owner": "cpp",
                "fileLocation": ["relative", "${workspaceRoot}/afolder"],
                "pattern": {
                    "regexp": "\\x22(.*)\\x22,\\s+line\\s+(\\d+):\\s+(Warning|Error):\\s+(.*)$",
                    "file": 1,
                    "line": 2,
                    "severity": 3,
                    "message": 4
                }
            },
            "isBuildCommand": true,
            "args": ["python waf buildall"]
        },
        {
            "taskName": "pwd",
            "args": ["cd"]
        }
    ]
}

data.title: Do not fs.realpath workspace paths so that symlinks are left intact
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 pro 14393.693

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create folder c:\test
2. Create empty text file c:\test\test.txt
3. Create directory junction in d:\ to c:\test
4. Open d:\test\test.txt
5. Notice that the path is given as c:\test\test.txt not d:\test\test.txt

This can be problematic, particular when copy/pasting the path to use in other applications or using extensions for source control, e.g. Perforce as they may not recognise the file.

data.title: Feature Request: Remote Operations
data.body:
I was wondering if there was a way to run commands over an SSH connection / if an ssh connection can be established at build time. If not that would be awesome to have.

Basically, when you build it would:

1. Connect to an SSH connection
2. Execute commands on the remote server (like g++ for example) and let you run them in the integrated terminal

I bring this up because on mac it's rather easy to mount the external filesystem and use the integrated terminal but on windows it's a much longer process. If it can already be done I apologize for wasting time. Cheers.

data.title: Feature Request : use nodegit instead of relying for a local git installation for Git Operations

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
the current versions of SCM in code relies on a local Git Installation for Git VCS operations.

Nodegit uses libgit2 which is a portable Git API, which allows VS Code to run SCM without requiring too much on a local installation.

Complements #329

data.title: Code --uninstall-extension shows Cancelled
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Version 1607

**Steps to Reproduce (--list-extensions) :**

1. Install two or more extensions using either the Marketplace or vsix packages.
2. Open a command prompt.
3. Run '--list-extensions'.

Result: Only the first installed extension is returned.  Screenshot below.

**Steps to Reproduce (--uninstall-extension) :**

1. Open a command prompt.
2. Run '--uninstall-extension [extension]'.

Result: The uninstall process appears to start but then is immediately cancelled. Screenshot below.

I am using the instructions found here: https://code.visualstudio.com/Docs/editor/extension-gallery#_command-line-extension-management

Thanks and please let me know if you need any additional information.

**Screenshot**
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11825888/22135140/1eec64c0-de81-11e6-8ef5-0e60f18ff844.png)

data.title: inconsistent behaviour of delete command in debug console under nodejs
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: 1607 build 14393.693


- Node Version: 6.5.0

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new project with a simple _app.js_ file.
2. Copy snippet below to _app.js_
```
'use strict';
var x = {first: "j", last: "s", age: 35};
console.assert(x.age == 35);
delete x.first;
console.assert(x.age == 35);
delete x['last'];
console.assert(x.age == 35);
delete x['notexist'];
console.assert(x.age == 35);
delete x.notexist;
console.assert(x.age == 35);
```
3. Make a _launch.json_ configuration with **type:** _node_ or _node2_
4. The file will run and complete without errors.
5. Place a breakpoint in the code on **line 8:** _delete x['notexist'];_
6. Manually type the following code line by line into the **Debug Console**
```
delete x['notexist'];
x;
delete x.notexist;
x;
```
7. Match to the output I am recieving:
```
delete x['notexist'];
"true"
x;
Object {age: 35}
delete x.notexist;
TypeError: Cannot convert undefined or null to object
x;
undefined
```

The behaviour shown is well outside what I would expect. I would expect that under strict mode _delete x['notexist'];_ would return a _TypeError_ and leave object x unchanged. The second operation _delete x.notexist;_ does return the error, but it also sets object x to _undefined_.

**N.B.** This only occurs under strict mode.

I have searched for an explanation for this behaviour and can't find one. If it is intentional I would appreciate understanding why.

data.title: Support Local File Links from the Markdown Preview
data.body:
Fixes #989

**Bug**

* `file://` links do not work in the markdown preview.
* `./file.ext` and `/file.ext` and `file.ext` links do not work in the markdown preview.

**Fix**
For the first issue, allow `file://` links explicitly.

For the second, add a custom link normalizer. If the incoming link has no scheme, try to resolve it relative to the current file or workspace. Links like `/file.ext` are relative to the workspace, while links like `file.ext` or `./file.ext` are relative to the current file.

Also did some refactoring to extract renderer to own file

milestone.title: Backlog

data.title: Add Markdown Document Link Provider To Support Local Links
data.body:
Fixes #3771

Adds a markdown document link detector to detect any type of markdown link. Currently, local links like `[abc](./xyz)` are not supported. 

This change allows navigating between markdown editor documents using these local links

data.title: #18467 Preserve panel maximization on zoom
data.body:
Implementation of #18467 

Currently, zooming out while the panel is maximized causes the panel to be large, but no longer maximized. This PR preserves the panel maximization state through zooming in / out.

data.title: Git side-by-side diff functionality does not show the whitespace
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: OS X 10.12.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. I have a file that I modified a line, and added whitespace to another line on the file that's not on the same diff area.
2. If I run `git diff` on my codebase I see the whitespace added clearly.
3. If I click Git icon from VSCode sidebar and click on that file, I don't see the diff for the line that has whitespace added.

Is this by design?

git diff output:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/159209/22129399/8d7f64d6-de5a-11e6-9dda-eff68ffc5e97.png)

vscode git diff screen (pay attention to line 68, right side has whitespace):

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/159209/22129413/a14e0e86-de5a-11e6-8c6f-2a912f759ade.png)

the other non-whitespace diff is shown just fine on vscode:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/159209/22129415/aa35b706-de5a-11e6-9ce9-4a7baf027eaa.png)

data.title: Feature request: multiple cursors case retaining editing

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Many times when I'm adjusting code, I'm copying it from some other code and then changing names that appear at different locations in camelCase. E.g. changing `userType` and `getUserMode` to `playerType` and `getPlayerMode`.

Using multiple cursors, you can case-insensitively match `user`, but when you then type `player`, the second word becomes `getplayerMode` and you need to go hunt for all the places were you need to fix it.

It would be great if multicursor could have a case retaining mode so that uppercase letters would be replaced with an uppercase letter. So, you'd select `user`, and the upper/lower shape of the selected words is retained while you are typing.
